headline: Nightmare to work for and a nightmare to work with
pros:
25 Days annual leave

Access to flexible benefits (buy & sell, pension etc) and employee savings site. These are the same solutions you'll be selling into clients

£97 monthly top-up on a pre-paid Mastercard which can be spent on food & drink
cons:
Late or withheld commissions or incentives (in excess of 30 days, often much much longer). Management will often fail to provide any clear reasoning as to the delay or why payments are being withheld. This applied to currently employed or staff who had recently left. Practice is to say its delayed by "two weeks" and hope its forgotten. The same is done to staff who are about to leave, past their effective last day at which point management will no longer communicate with you. Sadly this is seen to the extent of £1,000s and not just £1s! DO NOT RELY ON TIMELY PAYMENT OR THESE SUMS.

Capped commission. Accelerators are in place, however your commission will not exceed over a 12 month period £10,000. 

This is a cold lead generating role, masking as account management or warm client nurturing. You'll be given up to 1,000 clients to "manage", however their sales database is so poorly kept, the vast majority of client contacts will not be current. An for those which are correct, engagement is so poor, clients will be unaware of who Edenred are or wouldn't of been aware of a change in their account management. You'll receive very few leads from Marketing and will be hitting targets on your own generation ability.

Poor office environment. Staff break-room / kitchen was removed in late 2020 / early 2021. This was never replaced and staff either eat at their desk or in their cars (if they have been able to park at the office, the business doesn't lease enough parking spaces for the number of staff based in the Chester office which causes friction with other tenants). You'll hear lots of plans about incoming improvements to the current office or that they are looking at moving, a lot of talk and little action.

Business is missing clear organisational process, organigram to find those responsible or who can assist and too many departments that operate inefficiently or fail to take responsibility for tasks. If you are looking to get something done to close a sale or help a client, prepare to go through a mountain of pain to potentially achieve something simple. I have never worked somewhere where its even been made difficult for a client to pay the business! This poor structure, over many many years has lead to continued tension and in-fighting between departments.

Annual employee engagement results are not shared (I suspect due to how negative they were). There needs to be more ownership of internal issues and communication on these. Silence is louder than talking.

headline: Frustrating !
pros: There are some good people at Edenred UK. Products however are a little behind the times....
cons:
Products are behind the times, have only just introduced a App for the employee benefit service, so years behind their main competitors. Have focussed for too long on childcare vouchers and have failed to invest and update their other platforms and services, and as a consequence present an outdated, inconsistent service solution for clients. Malware attack in 2019 showed how frail their business continuity planning was, which was further tested and showed to be flawed when covid hit.
Really do not have a clear strategy or vision. Very difficult place to work and succeed as very siloed, and not particularly well supported from a the product development or finance teams.

Could do better !

headline: Unprofessional. Closed down India business overnight
pros: Good colleagues, but everyone has been sacked now.
cons:
A) DISHONEST. They tell us company is not doing well. But check their 2020 revenues, it's on google.
Q1 + Q2 Revenue = Euro 696 million.

B) ZERO concern for employees wellbeing. They suddenly send us an email for townhall meeting, annouce they are sold to Sodexo and sack everyone.

C) They call themselves MNC but have attitude of grocery shop owners.

D) We support company in tough times. Yet they sack us, inspite of making Net Profit = Euro 100 million in 2020 so far.

E) They have another company called Accentiv' India. Even many of their employees have been sacked. God knows if they will sell Accentiv' also and spoil more careers.

The purpose of the company: making the working world a better place for all. We are fighting on daily basis to improve the well-being of employees. It makes super sens if we consider the evolution of the world. It s time to take care!
We are lucky enough to live the digital transformation: from paper vouchers to prepaid cards, to mobile payment, to virtual cards. We are reinventing our products, processes and mindset. It s very exiting! And the group has the financial capacity to invest massively.
cons: We are a sum of mid size business unit. So if you want a career path, it s better to envision an international journey

good people working on selling a very good product
nice office with huge spaces
cons:
doubtful skills of members of the management 
horrible people management
no effort of keeping the best people

headline: Product coordinator
pros: Great benefits, young environment d
cons: It prides itself as a millennial company, but it isn’t (you still have to check assistance and schedule isn’t as flexible as they say).  Pay is quite low, but the perks make up for it

headline: Poor management
pros: flexible working hour. (come late to office is fine as MD comes very late almost every day)
cons:
Not clear Roles and responsibility. It is decided by MD. 
The company runs by only a few people who are very close to MD.

headline: Good company
pros:
I had a great experience in the company, mainly because of the team of digital channels, the coordinator was very good.
The attention for the staff are incredible there, the infrastructure is very good.
cons: Difficult to implement optimizations because of IT team, one simple task could take 2 or 3 months, and, even with this period, they deliver with a lot of bugs.

headline: No Progression
pros:
The people. Work with some great people across the departments who do their best to make things work.
The benefits are good.
cons: No career progression. Antiquated systems. No pathway for internal development. Low pay. Talented quality people leaving on a regular basis.

headline: Project Manager / Product Owner
pros: Organisation , Benefits, Additional courses , Location , International company
cons: Salary is not appropriate to the position

headline: Sales
pros: Incentives and HR practice is great
cons: Management is not very clear and selfish

headline: Archaic tech and upper management with a bunker mentality
pros:
Work life balance good - 
Benefits generally good
cons:
Office space needs sorting 
micromanagement carried out - no trust in employees
Clique culture amongst foreign managers(us vs them mentality)

headline: Good place to work
pros: Lovely people to work with
cons: Low salary meant you are unable to stay

headline: Everything depends on the mood of the MD
pros: the people... that's pretty much it, and in all the leaving speeches the main thing is "you stay for the people". i'm guilty of that
cons:
Be prepared to not progress unless you move dept. 
Structured career development does not exist, you have to force their hand
They think it's cheaper to replace an employee than to pay them a bit more
Everything seems to be signed of the by the MD (of northern Europe) and not the actual UK MD. Absolute joke given he no longer is responsible for the day to day of the business. 
Archaic office with practically no natural light
Even more archaic systems with PC's direct from the stone age

headline: Company with great potential. Value talents.
pros:
Management team values talents - truly caring, willing to arrange rotations when asked. 
Very good work life balance - office empty before 19:00. 
Relatively small size team, thus easily recognized when doing things right or have special talent.
cons: Relatively small team, promotion was quite slow because you gotta wait for a vacant position, which rarely happens because people stay here for a long time.

headline: Good, but not the best
pros: good opportunity to grow, and to learn something new
cons: the overwork cause toxic environment

headline: Decent
pros: A nice working environment. Left to your own devices which is nice for senior level employees.
cons: Salary is not in line with the market. There is limited room for progression depending on what department you are in.

headline: Poor people management
pros: Doesn't micromanage, allow staffs to come to work late, medical coverage
cons: Have to OT without OT pay every single day, people and people relationship are bad, backstabbing and gossiping everywhere. Jealousy everywhere.

headline: Technical Architect

headline: Jobs at Edenred

cons: HQ management team interfere too much and always gave priority to their own people.

headline: Company with a good environment, it has some problems like any other company, but in general it is good in the IT area

cons: The company suffers with lack of good professionals and leaders and this leads to poor results. The areas has the habit of competing with each other, moreover the employees are afraid to say no to their directors. Because this the executor teams usually stay overloaded.

headline: good work life balance

headline: Great company

headline: Edenred review for your consideration

great team to work with

management is solely focused on making their lives easier. 
micro managing

headline: Software developer
pros: Friendly environment  to work, casual dress, 4 summer friday off
cons: Company is not growing much.

headline: Family feel
pros: Ambitious top down strategy, good work life balance
cons: Old technology and old fashioned mindset

headline: The work is great, but they don't value employees as much as they should.  I regularly work 50+ hours with no incentive.
pros: I don't have to punch in.  They give me the ability to self manage.  I hate micromanagement, and there isn't a lot of that at this company.
cons: The disconnect between the work I do, acknowledgment, and the salary I get.  I feel they would rather lose people and pay for temps than invest in the employees they already have.  High turnaround at this office.

headline: Sales
pros: Decent company benefits, some good colleagues trying their best.
cons: I have worked in companies with a heavy top-down management structure, but here it is a whole other ball game. Some of the senior team, you wonder how long a company can last with them giving direction. You don't succeed at Edenred, you survive until you find something better. Poor IT systems, old and ugly office, some good people doing good work but overall a poor experience. Nobody is accountable for quality, and a lot of blaming goes on. Teams barely co-operate, a lot of internal politics and team v team culture.

headline: It was good
pros: Good work-environment, employee friendly HR, Freedom to work
cons: Not much incentives on the achievements, less recognition.

headline: A rather dissapointing experience...
pros: I worked alongside some great, hard-working colleagues.
cons: A lack of entreprenerurship and the ability to grow with the times  from top level management trickled down to all departments. Directors were too busy figuring out how to save money, rather than trying to do what was best for their employees and for the company as a whole. I was severely underpaid and had to push my wight around to attempt to progress professionally. In the end i know my resignation was definitely their loss rather than mine.

headline: A great company!
pros: A great experience that offers many opportunities to learn and improve your professional expertise. Passionate people with much creativity and engagement.
cons: International career paths and rules may be better formalized

headline: Good company to work for
pros: Great people, work hard play hard mentality. Well looked after at more senior level. Salary in line with expectations. Overall very positive.
cons: Solutions somewhat disparate due to the nature by which the business has been grown, via acquisition. Some management and departments are hard to work with.

headline: Company Review
pros: Fine place to work. Got along with everyone and no issues.

headline: Great place to work!
